job_title: Inclusive NOAA Fisheries Internship Program (IN FISH)
clearance_req: U.S. citizen or U.S. national; enrolled undergraduate at time of application
salary_compensation: $6,000 stipend; tuition and course supplies covered
duty_station: NOAA Fisheries or partner labs nationwide (in-person, hybrid, or virtual)
responsiblities_sum: Complete a 2-week ecosystems dynamics course for credit followed by 8 weeks of mentored research or management project; weekly professional development; computational workshops (R, R Shiny, GIS); research or management deliverables; student symposium participation.
desired_education_sum: Undergraduate enrollment at accredited institution; interest in marine science, fisheries, or resource management.
req_skills_sum: Basic research and data collection; communication; teamwork; introductory data or computational skills.
pref_skills_sum: Interest in graduate school or NOAA careers; prior coursework or experience in marine or environmental sciences.
work_conditions_sum: Full-time summer internship; office, lab, field, or virtual settings depending on placement.
application_components: Online application via NOAA Fisheries IN FISH portal.
poss_project: Marine research and fisheries management projects
poss_transport: Travel may be required depending on placement
poss_professdev: Professional development, networking, R and GIS technical training
pert_details_sum: Includes professional development, networking, and technical skill building; modeled after PEP and APEP programs.
contact_info_email: Contact via NOAA Fisheries IN FISH page
